definition: to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony

sentences.english: Integration of East and West, . It embodies that Our designing occupation is elegant and in good taste.
sentences.chinese: 取融汇东西，喻设计职业，文化与艺术之态。

sentences.english: However over time, the two homepages will converge.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的过去，两种形式的主页在融汇贯通。

sentences.english: The art shopping centre integrates the features of the Chinese culture with the Western art.
sentences.chinese: 天工艺苑商场融汇中国文化和西方艺术特色。

sentences.english: The development of national culture goes side by side with the assimilation of foreign culture.
sentences.chinese: 民族文化的发展历程伴随与异文化的融汇过程。

sentences.english: Computer fans of University of Science and Technology of China share their ideas and talents here.
sentences.chinese: 中国科大的电脑爱好者们在这里集结思想，融汇技术。

sentences.english: Africa is where the world meets.
sentences.chinese: 非洲是世界交流融汇之地。

definition: mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
a mixture/an amalgam/fusion/welding together/to be in harmony with (nature)/to harmonize with/to fit in
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
to collect/to compile/to converge/also written 彙集|汇集[hui4 ji2]
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
variant of 交匯|交汇/to flow together/confluence (of rivers, airflow, roads)/(international) cooperation
to flow together/confluence (of rivers, airflow, roads)/(international) cooperation
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
